partitions.cover: A section that introduces the work, often consisting of a marketing image, the title, author and publisher, and select quotes and reviews.
partitions.frontmatter: Preliminary material to the main content of a publication, such as tables of contents, dedications, etc.
partitions.bodymatter: The main content of a publication.
partitions.backmatter: Ancillary material occurring after the main content of a publication, such as indices, appendices, etc.

divisions.part: A major structural division in a work that contains a set of related sections dealing with a particular subject, narrative arc or similar encapsulated theme.
divisions.chapter: A major thematic section of content in a work.
divisions.division: A major structural division that may also appear as a substructure of a part (esp. in legislation).

navigation.toc: A navigational aid that provides an ordered list of links to the major sectional headings in the content. A table of contents may cover an entire work, or only a smaller section of it.
navigation.toc-brief: An abridged version of the table of contents.
navigation.landmarks: A collection of references to well-known/recurring components within the publication
navigation.loa: A listing of audio clips included in the work.
navigation.loi: A listing of illustrations included in the work.
navigation.lot: A listing of tables included in the work.
navigation.lov: A listing of video clips included in the work.

indexes.index: A navigational aid that provides a detailed list of links to key subjects, names and other important topics covered in the work.
indexes.index-headnotes: Narrative or other content to assist users in using the index.
indexes.index-legend: List of symbols, abbreviations or special formatting used in the index, and their meanings.
indexes.index-group: Collection of consecutive main entries that share a common characteristic, for example the starting letter of the main entries.
indexes.index-entry-list: Collection of consecutive main entries or subentries.
indexes.index-entry: One term with any attendant subentries, locators, cross references, and/or editorial note.
indexes.index-term: Word, phrase, string, glyph or image representing the indexable content.
indexes.index-editor-note: Editorial note pertaining to a single entry.
indexes.index-locator: A reference to an occurrence of the indexed content in the publication.
indexes.index-locator-list: Collection of sequential locators or locator ranges.
indexes.index-locator-range: A pair of locators that connects a term to a range of content rather than a single point.
indexes.index-xref-preferred: Reference from one term to one or more preferred terms or term categories in an index (analogous to "See xxx").
indexes.index-xref-related: Reference from one term to one or more related terms or term categories in an index (analogous to "See also xxx").
indexes.index-term-category: Word, phrase, string, glyph or image representing a category of terms in the index.
indexes.index-term-categories: Wrapper for a list of the term categories belonging to an index.

glossaries.glossary: A brief dictionary of new, uncommon or specialized terms used in the content.
glossaries.glossdef:
The definition of a
.
term in a glossary

bibliographies.bibliography: A list of external references cited in the work, which may be to print or digital sources.
bibliographies.biblioentry:
A single reference to an external source in a
. A biblioentry typically provides more detailed information than its reference(s) in the content (e.g., full title, author(s), publisher, publication date, etc.).
bibliography

asides.case-study: A detailed analysis of a specific topic.
asides.notice: Notifies the user of consequences that might arise from an action or event. Examples include warnings, cautions and dangers.
asides.pullquote: A distinctively placed or highlighted quotation from the current content designed to draw attention to a topic or highlight a key point.
asides.tip: Helpful information that clarifies some aspect of the content or assists in its comprehension.

learning-obj.learning-objective: An explicit designation or description of a learning objective or a reference to an explicit learning objective.
learning-obj.learning-outcome: The understanding or ability a student is expected to achieve as a result of a lesson or activity.
learning-obj.learning-resource: A resource provided to enhance learning, or a reference to such a resource.
learning-obj.learning-standard: A formal set of expectations or requirements typically issued by a government or a standards body.

testing.answer: The component of a self-assessment problem that provides the answer to the question.
testing.assessment: A test, quiz, or other activity that helps measure a student's understanding of what is being taught.
testing.feedback: Instruction to the reader based on the result of an assessment.
testing.fill-in-the-blank-problem: A problem that requires the reader to input a text answer to complete a sentence, statement or similar.
testing.general-problem: A problem with a free-form solution.
testing.qna: A section of content structured as a series of questions and answers, such as an interview or list of frequently asked questions.
testing.match-problem: A problem that requires the reader to match the contents of one list with the corresponding items in another list.
testing.multiple-choice-problem: A problem with a set of potential answers to choose from â€’ some, all or none of which may be correct.
testing.question: The component of a self-assessment problem that identifies the question to be solved.
testing.true-false-problem: A problem with either a true or false answer.

comics.panel-group:
A group of
(e.g., a strip).
panels
comics.balloon:
An area in a comic
that contains the words, spoken or thought, of a character.
panel
comics.text-area:
An area of text in a comic
. Used to represent titles, narrative text, character dialogue (inside a
or not) and similar.
panel
balloon
comics.sound-area:
An area of text in a comic
that represents a sound.
panel

notes.footnote: Ancillary information, such as a citation or commentary, that provides additional context to a referenced passage of text.
notes.prologue: An introductory section that sets the background to a work, typically part of the narrative.
notes.endnote: One of a collection of notes that occur at the end of a work, or a section within it, that provides additional context to a referenced passage of text.
notes.endnotes: A collection of notes at the end of a work or a section within it.

links.biblioref:
A reference to a
.
bibliography entry
links.glossref:
A reference to a
.
glossary definition
links.noteref: A reference to a note, typically appearing as a superscripted number or symbol in the main body of text.
links.backlink:
A link that allows the user to return to a related location in the content (e.g., from a
to its reference or from a
to where a
is used).
footnote
glossary definition
term

document-text.credit: An acknowledgment of the source of integrated content from third-party sources, such as photos. Typically identifies the creator, copyright and any restrictions on reuse.
document-text.topic-sentence: A phrase or sentence serving as an introductory summary of the containing paragraph.
document-text.concluding-sentence: A phrase or sentence serving as a concluding summary of the containing paragraph.

pagination.pagebreak: A separator denoting the position before which a break occurs between two contiguous pages in a statically paginated version of the content.
pagination.page-list:
A navigational aid that provides a list of links to the
in the content.
pagebreaks

tables.table: A structure containing data or content laid out in tabular form.
tables.table-row: A row of data or content in a tabular structure.
tables.table-cell: A single cell of tabular data or content.

lists.list: A structure that contains an enumeration of related content items.
lists.list-item: A single item in an enumeration.

figures.figure: An illustration, diagram, photo, code listing or similar, referenced from the text of a work, and typically annotated with a title, caption and/or credits.

titles.halftitle: The title appearing on the first page of a work or immediately before the text.
titles.fulltitle:
The full title of the work, either simple, in which case it is identical to
, or compound, in which case it consists of a
and a
.
title
title
subtitle
titles.title: The primary name of a document component, such as a list, table or figure.
titles.subtitle: An explanatory or alternate title for the work, or a section or component within it.
titles.label:
The text label that precedes an
in a component title (e.g., 'Chapter', 'Part', 'Figure', 'Table').
ordinal
titles.ordinal: An ordinal specifier for a component in a sequence of components (e.g., '1', 'IV', 'B-1').
titles.bridgehead: A structurally insignificant heading that does not contribute to the hierarchical structure of the work.

titles.covertitle: The title of the work as displayed on the work's cover.

preliminary.titlepage: The title page of the work.
preliminary.halftitlepage: The half title page of the work.
preliminary.copyright-page: The copyright page of the work.
preliminary.seriespage: Marketing section used to list related publications.
preliminary.acknowledgments: A section or statement that acknowledges significant contributions by persons, organizations, governments and other entities to the realization of the work.
preliminary.imprint: Information relating to the publication or distribution of the work.
preliminary.imprimatur: A formal statement authorizing the publication of the work.
preliminary.contributors: A list of contributors to the work.
preliminary.other-credits: Acknowledgments of previously published parts of the work, illustration credits, and permission to quote from copyrighted material.
preliminary.errata: A set of corrections discovered after initial publication of the work, sometimes referred to as corrigenda.
preliminary.dedication: An inscription at the front of the work, typically addressed in tribute to one or more persons close to the author.
preliminary.revision-history: A record of changes made to a work.

sections.abstract: A short summary of the principle ideas, concepts and conclusions of the work, or of a section or excerpt within it.
sections.foreword: An introductory section that precedes the work, typically not written by the author of the work.
sections.preface: An introductory section that precedes the work, typically written by the author of the work.
sections.introduction: A preliminary section that typically introduces the scope or nature of the work.
sections.preamble: A section in the beginning of the work, typically containing introductory and/or explanatory prose regarding the scope or nature of the work's content
sections.epigraph: A quotation set at the start of the work or a section that establishes the theme or sets the mood.

references.appendix: A section of supplemental information located after the primary content that informs the content but is not central to it.
references.colophon: A short section of production notes particular to the edition (e.g., describing the typeface used), often located at the end of a work.

bibliographies.bibliography: A list of external references cited in the work, which may be to print or digital sources.
bibliographies.biblioentry:
A single reference to an external source in a
. A biblioentry typically provides more detailed information than its reference(s) in the content (e.g., full title, author(s), publisher, publication date, etc.).
bibliography

glossaries.glossary: A brief dictionary of new, uncommon or specialized terms used in the content.
glossaries.glossdef:
The definition of a
.
term in a glossary

sections.conclusion: A concluding section or statement that summarizes the work or wraps up the narrative.
sections.epilogue: A concluding section of narrative that wraps up or comments on the actions and events of the work, typically from a future perspective.
sections.afterword: A closing statement from the author or a person of importance, typically providing insight into how the content came to be written, its significance, or related events that have transpired since its timeline.
